title: Downloading and Installing WhatsApp to Your Android Device

steps.title: Open the Google Play Store app on your Android.
steps.content: Open the Google Play Store app on your Android. The Google Play Store app has an icon that resembles a colorful triangle. Find and tap the icon on your Home screen or Apps tray to open the Play Store. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the search bar at the top.
steps.content: Tap the search bar at the top. The search bar is at the top of the page. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Search WhatsApp in Google Play.
steps.content: Search WhatsApp in Google Play. Type the app's name, and tap the Enter or Return button on your keyboard. This will list all the matching results. [3] X Research source On some keyboards, you may also find a Search or the magnifying glass button.

steps.title: Tap the green Install button next to WhatsApp Messenger.
steps.content: Tap the green Install button next to WhatsApp Messenger. This should be the top match in your search results. This will start your download, and install WhatsApp on your Android. [4] X Research source The WhatsApp icon looks like a white telephone in a green speech bubble.

steps.title: Open the WhatsApp Messenger app on your Android.
steps.content: Open the WhatsApp Messenger app on your Android. The WhatsApp icon looks like a white phone in a green speech bubble. You can find it on your home screen or Apps menu. Alternatively, you can tap Open in the Google Play Store once WhatsApp finishes downloading.

steps.title: Select your language and tap the arrow icon.
steps.content: Select your language and tap the arrow icon. Tap the radio option next to your preferred language. The language you have selected on your Android phone will be selected by default. Tap the green arrow icon in the lower-right corner to continue.

steps.title: Tap Agree and Continue.
steps.content: Tap Agree and Continue . It's the green button at the bottom of the screen. This will start your account set-up process.

steps.title: Tap ALLOW.
steps.content: Tap ALLOW . This will allow WhatsApp to export your contacts from your phonebook, and access photos, media, and files to share with your contacts in your chats.

steps.title: Enter your valid phone number and tap Next.
steps.content: Enter your valid phone number and tap Next . Make sure to include your country code at the beginning or select your country from the drop-down menu. Tap Next at the bottom of the screen when you are ready to continue. [5] X Research source You will have to verify your number in the following steps.

steps.title: Tap Yes.
steps.content: Tap Yes . Check your number and verify that it is correct. If the number is correct, tap Yes to continue. If it is not correct, tap Edit and enter the correct number.

steps.title: Enter your six-digit verification code.
steps.content: Enter your six-digit verification code. Find your verification code in the automated text message from WhatsApp, and enter it here to verify your number. [6] X Research source If you receive text messages on the same Android phone, you may be able to enter the code automatically. To do so, tap Continue .

steps.title: Restore your backup (if you have one).
steps.content: Restore your backup (if you have one). If you have a backup of your previous chats , tap Continue and select an account that your backup is saved to. If you do not have a backup, tap Skip instead.

steps.title: Enter a username for yourself.
steps.content: Enter a username for yourself. Use your keyboard to enter a username for your account, and tap Next to confirm. Optionally, you can enter the gray-and-white camera icon next to the username, and upload a profile picture. You can change your username later on in the Settings menu.

steps.title: Create a passkey (optional).
steps.content: Create a passkey (optional). A passkey allows you to log in to WhatsApp using your fingerprint, face, screen lock code, or pattern. If you want to create a passkey, tap Create passkey and follow the on-screen instructions to create a passkey for your device. If you don't want to create a passkey, tap Skip . Afterward, your WhatsApp account will be created and you will be ready to start using WhatsApp.
